Detailed Description

Definitions for CTK SPE thread group macros and routines.

Define Documentation

#define CTK_SPE_THREAD_GROUP_MAX   32

The system limit of the max number of SPE threads one group can accomodate

Typedef Documentation

typedef ctk_spe_thread_group_body_t* ctk_spe_thread_group_t

SPE thread group handle

Function Documentation

int ctk_intr_mbox_group_read_block ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group,
ctk_uint32_t  data[] 
)

Reads the contents of the SPU outbound interrupt mailbox for the threads in the given SPE thread group. This blocks if the mailbox is empty. [Blocking]

Parameters:
[in] group - the SPE thread group
[out] data - array of the value of the Mailbox.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_mbox_group_read_block ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group,
ctk_uint32_t  data[] 
)

Reads the contents of the SPU outbound mailbox for the threads in the given SPE thread group. This blocks if the mailbox is empty. [Blocking]

Parameters:
[in] group - the SPE thread group
[out] data - array of the value of the Mailbox.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_mbox_group_write ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group,
ctk_uint32_t  data 
)

Writes the 32-bit data specified by data into the SPU inbound mailbox for the threads in the given SPE thread group. [Non-blocking] If the mailbox is full, then ctk_mbox_write may overwrite the last entry in the mailbox. The ctk_mbox_write_count function can be called to ensure the space is available prior to writing to the inbound mailbox.

Parameters:
[in] group - the SPE thread group
[in] data - the value to be written.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_mbox_group_write_block ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group,
ctk_uint32_t  data 
)

Writes the 32-bit data specified by data into the SPU inbound mailbox for the threads in the given SPE thread group. [Blocking] The call blocks if the mailbox is full.

Parameters:
[in] group - the SPE thread group
[in] data - the value to be written.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_signal_group_write ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  spe,
unsigned int  reg,
unsigned int  data 
)

Writes the data to the signal notification register specified by reg for the threads in the given SPE thread group.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE thread group
[in] reg - the signal register. This can be one of either CTK_SIGNAL_REG1 or CTK_SIGNAL_REG2.
[in] data - the 32-bit data to be written
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

static int ctk_signal_group_write_reg1 ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  spe,
unsigned int  data 
) [inline, static]

Writes the data to the signal notification register 1 for the threads in the given SPE thread group.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose outbound mailbox is to be read.
[in] data - the 32-bit data to be written
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

static int ctk_signal_group_write_reg2 ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  spe,
unsigned int  data 
) [inline, static]

Writes the data to the signal notification register 2 for the threads in the given SPE thread group.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose outbound mailbox is to be read.
[in] data - the 32-bit data to be written
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_spe_thread_group_add ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group,
ctk_spe_thread_t  thread 
)

Adds a SPE thread to the given SPE thread group.

Parameters:
[in] group - A SPE thread group
[in] thread - A SPE thread to be added (NOTE: the given thread must not be started; i.e., the thread must have been created with CTK_SPE_DONT_START flag.)
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.

int ctk_spe_thread_group_add_access_hint ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group,
void *  addr,
ea_size_t  size 
)

Adds access hints to the thread group

int ctk_spe_thread_group_create ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t *  group,
int  max,
int  options 
)

Creates a new SPE thread group.

Parameters:
[out] group - pointer to store the created SPE thread group
[in] max - The max number of SPE threads the group can accomodate
[in] options - A bit-wise OR of modifiers that are applied when the new thread group is created. (Currently there's no valid modifier is specified)
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.

int ctk_spe_thread_group_create_spmd ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t *  group,
int  nthreads,
ctk_spe_program_t *  program,
void *  argp,
void *  envp,
int  flags 
)

Creates and starts a new SPE thread group which contains a set of SPMD (Single Program Multiple Data) type threads.

Parameters:
[out] group - pointer to store the created SPE thread group
[in] nthreads - the number of SPE threads
[in] program - SPE program handle
[in] argp - Argument pointer for the SPE thread
[in] envp - pointer to environment specific data for the SPE thread
[in] flags - A bit-wise OR of modifiers that are applied when the new thread is created. 0 (no flag) or any combination of CTK_SPE_USER_REGS, CTK_SPE_CFG_SIGNOTIFY1_OR, CTK_SPE_CFG_SIGNOTIFY2_OR and CTK_SPE_DONT_START can be specified.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS if all of the threads in the given group started successfully, ERRNO otherwise. Call ctk_spe_thread_group_get_threads_count to get the current number of active (i.e., actually created) SPE threads.

int ctk_spe_thread_group_get_threads ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group,
ctk_spe_thread_t *  spes 
)

Returns an array of SPE threads in the given group. (The array must be allocated by the caller.)

static int ctk_spe_thread_group_get_threads_count ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group  )  [inline, static]

Returns the number of SPE threads in the given group.

int ctk_spe_thread_group_remove_access_hint ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group,
void *  addr 
)

Removes access hints from the thread group

int ctk_spe_thread_group_start ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group,
int *  nstarted 
)

Starts the given SPE thread group.

Parameters:
[in] group - A SPE thread group
[out] nstarted - the number of SPE thread actually started
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS if all of the threads in the given group started successfully, ERRNO otherwise.

int ctk_spe_thread_group_terminate ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group  ) 

Terminates all of the SPE threads in the given SPE thread group and frees the resources.

Deprecated:
Note:
This may not actually stop the SPE execution until it voluntarily releases the physical SPEs. !!!Do not cleanup PPE resources while there could be any DMA or synchronization activities!!!
Parameters:
[in] group - the SPE thread group
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.

int ctk_spe_thread_group_wait ( ctk_spe_thread_group_t  group,
int *  statuses 
)

Waits until all of the SPE threads in the given SPE thread group exit and frees the resources.

Parameters:
[in] group - the SPE thread group
[out] statuses - a pointer to an array of the SPE exit statuses. The storage for the array must be allocated by the caller and it must be large enough to accomodate every exit code of the SPE threads in the group.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.
